meanings.definition: Capable of being taken or seized.
meanings.sent1: The shiny toy was very takeable for the little child.
meanings.sent2: The lost wallet on the sidewalk was easily takeable by anyone passing by.
meanings.sent3: The cookies on the counter looked so takeable, I couldn't resist grabbing one.
meanings.sent4: The opportunity to travel the world was a takeable dream for the young adventurer.
meanings.sent5: The colorful balloons at the fair were so takeable, they seemed to call out to the children.

meanings.definition: Suitable or desirable to be taken or accepted.
meanings.sent1: The job offer was very takeable, with its great benefits and flexible hours.
meanings.sent2: The gift of a book was a takeable present for the avid reader.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a picnic in the park was so takeable on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The opportunity to learn a new skill was a takeable chance for personal growth.
meanings.sent5: The invitation to the party was so takeable, I immediately RSVP'd.
